trans-unit.source: Provides a way to arrange content in a grid where all the cells in the grid have the same size.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.UniformGrid"></xref> class.
Defines the layout of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.UniformGrid"></xref> by distributing space evenly among all of the child elements.
The `arrangeSize` parameter defines the space in the layout area that is available for the grid.
For example, if there are two rows and four columns in a grid, the possible height for each cell is 0.5\**arrangeSizeHeight* and the maximum width is 0.25\**arrangeSizeWidth*.

For these calculations, *arrangeSizeHeight* is the <xref:System.Windows.Size.Height%2A> value of the `arrangeSize` parameter and *arrangeSizeWidth* is the <xref:System.Windows.Size.Width%2A> value of the `arrangeSize` parameter.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Size"></xref> of the area for the grid to use.
The actual <xref href="System.Windows.Size"></xref> of the grid that is rendered to display the child elements that are visible.
Gets or sets the number of columns that are in the grid.

A value of zero (0) for the Columns property specifies that the column count is computed based on the number of rows and the number of visible child elements that are in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Grid>.

The value of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.UniformGrid.FirstColumn%2A> must be less than the value of the Columns property for the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.UniformGrid> to work correctly.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`||
The number of columns that are in the grid.
The default is 0.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.UniformGrid.Columns*> dependency property.
To be added.
Gets or sets the number of leading blank cells in the first row of the grid.

The value of the FirstColumn must be less than the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.UniformGrid.Columns%2A> property for the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.UniformGrid> to work correctly.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`||
The number of empty cells that are in the first row of the grid.
The default is 0.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.UniformGrid.FirstColumn*> dependency property.
To be added.
Computes the desired size of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.UniformGrid"></xref> by measuring all of the child elements.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Size"></xref> of the available area for the grid.
The desired based on the child content of the grid and the constraint parameter.
Gets or sets the number of rows that are in the grid.
A value of zero (0) for the Rows property specifies that the row count is computed based on the number of columns and the number of visible child elements that are in the grid.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`||
The number of rows that are in the grid.
The default is 0.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.UniformGrid.Rows*> dependency property.
To be added.
